intro: Mammillaria winterae subsp. winterae, commonly known as the Winter's mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its globular shape and dense covering of small, white spines. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and produces yellow flowers during the spring. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water. Its compact size and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor collections.
